conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas during the process from state B to state C.
Use the formula for work done in a process where pressure and volume change: W = ∫ P dV.
Since the process from B to C is a horizontal line on the p-V diagram (constant pressure), simplify the work formula to W = P ΔV.
The pressure P at state B and state C is 2 × 10^5 Pa.
The volume at state B (VB) is 2 × 10^-3 m^3.
The volume at state C (VC) is 3 × 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate the change in volume ΔV: ΔV = VC - VB = 1 × 10^-3 m^3.
Substitute the values into the work formula: W = P ΔV = 2 × 10^5 Pa × 1 × 10^-3 m^3 = 200 J.
The work done by the gas from state B to state C is 200 J.
